Recipe 21 Preserved Lemons Preserved lemons are an incredible ingredient and so simple to make. Whatever you do don’t buy them! You’ll need a clear jar to keep them in. 21.1 Ingredients Unwaxed lemons salt 21.2 Method Sliced a lemon lengthways in a cross, not cutting all the way to the end. This will produce 4 lemon quarters that are attached together at one end of the lemon Open up the lemon and add 1 tbsp of salt, close and stuff tightly into your jar. Repeat until the jar is full Give the lemons a final squish down and close the jar. Check after 1 to 2 days. The lemons will have released lots of juice. Squash down again so the lemons are submerged in their juice. Leave for 1 month Your preserved lemons are now ready. Now you can make my Preserved Lemon and Sundried Tomato Pasta! Store in the fridge after opening, I think they basically last forever.
